result.execSummary:
The defendant Stephen G Werre was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Payable at the rate of $50.00 per month, starting on or before September 1, 2016 and on the same day each month thereafter, until paid in full.   Failure to pay any part of the fine or court costs in full by the due date will result in 1 day jail for each $25 left unpaid.  $15.00 payment plan fee added.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Stephen G Werre

defendant.name: Werre, Stephen G
defendant.address: 205 N Church Street, Alma Center, WI 54611

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: For the Return of Property Received
Advised Atty Matousek to prepare an Order consistent with DA's letter dated 10/3/16 re his Petition for Return of Property Seized.
of Angela Werre. Sent to Judge electronically 9/29.  JMM
for the Return of Property Seized.  Sent to Judge electronically 9/29.  JMM

ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Matousek.  Defendant plead no contest to obstructing.  Motion to amend Count 1 to Obstructing.  Granted.  Court recited the charge and possible penalties on the count he plead to.  Defendant understood.  Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant.  Defense stipulated that there is a factual basis for the plea.   Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily, and intelligently entered his plea and waived his constitutional rights.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the plea.  Found guilty of Obstructing, contrary to 946.41(1).  State recommended;  Fine of $500.00, plus costs.  Defense recommended:  lower fine.  $50/mo payment plan.  Court ordered:  $300.00 fine, plus costs.  Pay @ $50.00 per month, starting 9/1.    Failure to pay any part of the fine or court costs in full by the due date will result in 1 day jail for each $25 left unpaid.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 18, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant appears with counsel John Matousek.  Gerald Fox appears for the state.  Attorney Matousek requests case be set for plea on July11.  He is to talk to J.A.
From attorney Matousek's office along with DDI (Sent DDI to Judge to sign)
From Matousek's office along with NOR and Auth

Pre-trial conference on May 11, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on June 6, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Court questioned the defendant on his understanding of the waiver of time limits.  He stated he understood.  Court found that the defendant knowingly and intelligently waived the time limit for holding the preliminary hearing.
records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with  Attorney Matousek.  Waive the reading of the complaint.  PTC set for 5/11 and STC set for 6/6 at 3 pm.
